panels.description: Active connections as % of max_connections. Yellow >70%, Red >90%
panels.title: Connection Pool Utilization

panels.description: Idle in transaction connections hold locks and block autovacuum — dangerous!
panels.title: Idle in Transaction (Dangerous!)

panels.description: Used vs available connections vs max limit
panels.title: Connection Pool Status

panels.description: Max duration of active transactions. Growing = hung query. Yellow >30s, Red >60s
panels.title: Max Transaction Duration

panels.description: Active non-idle queries: pid, user, state, wait event, query text, duration. Updates every 20s.
panels.title: Long Running Queries

panels.description: Committed and rolled back transactions per second
panels.title: Transaction Throughput

panels.description: Cache hit ratio — should be >99%. Low = excessive disk I/O.
panels.title: Cache Hit Rate

panels.description: Row operations per second: inserts, updates, deletes, fetches
panels.title: DML Operations Rate

panels.description: Temp files written to disk — indicates work_mem is too low
panels.title: Temp Files (Bytes/s)

panels.description: Lock counts by mode. Spikes indicate contention.
panels.title: Lock Tables

panels.description: Dead tuples per table — high values mean autovacuum is not keeping up
panels.title: Dead Tuples (Top 10 Tables)

panels.description: Autovacuum and autoanalyze runs per hour per table
panels.title: Autovacuum Activity

panels.description: Sequential scans vs index scans — high seq_scan on large tables = missing index
panels.title: Seq Scan vs Index Scan (Top 10 Tables)

panels.description: Background writer buffer allocation and clean rate
panels.title: Buffers (bgwriter)

panels.description: Replication lag in seconds. Should be close to 0.
panels.title: Replication Lag
